qas.question: When was the Museo Tamayo opened?
Who's art collection was the reason the Museo Tamayo opened?
What type of art is shown in The Museo Carrillo Gil?
What famous art building was opened in late 2008?

context: Mexico City has numerous museums dedicated to art, including Mexican colonial, modern and contemporary art, and international art. The Museo Tamayo was opened in the <a0_0>mid-1980s<a0_0/> to house the collection of international contemporary art donated by famed Mexican (born in the state of <a2_0>Oaxaca<a2_0/>) painter <a1_0>Rufino Tamayo<a1_0/>. The collection includes pieces by Picasso, Klee, Kandinsky, Warhol and many others, though most of the collection is stored while visiting exhibits are shown. The Museo de Arte Moderno (Museum of Modern Art) is a repository of Mexican artists from the 20th century, including Rivera, Orozco, Siqueiros, Kahlo, Gerzso, Carrington, Tamayo, among others, and also regularly hosts temporary exhibits of international modern art. In southern Mexico City, the Museo Carrillo Gil (Carrillo Gil Museum) showcases <a3_0>avant-garde<a3_0/> artists, as does the <a4_0>University Museum/Contemporary Art<a4_0/> (Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo – or MUAC), designed by famed Mexican architect Teodoro González de León, inaugurated in late 2008.
